abstract: If razors get any more blades, they will be hard to maneuver. So Schick is focusing on making the shave ever smoother.
snippet: If razors get any more blades, they will be hard to maneuver. So Schick is focusing on making the shave ever smoother.
lead_paragraph: WHEN Gillette introduced the first three-bladed razor in the United States, the Mach 3, in 1998, it struck some as absurd, and “Saturday Night Live” at the time pitched a 14-blade razor in a parody commercial. But blade escalation continued: Rival Schick introduced the four-bladed Quattro in 2003, and Gillette struck back with the five-bladed Fusion in 2005.

headline.main: New Razors Place Focus on Comfort, Not Blade Count
headline.print_headline: New Razors Place Focus On Comfort, Not Blade Count
